classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B2, B3, (B4 [lab] must be completed with either B2 or B3), C1, C2, C3, C4, C1-C5 elective, D1, D3, D4, D5 and F. C4, D5 and F should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). NO BUS FOR D5. Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C3, C4, D1, D3, D4, D5 or F.
Any free elective can go here. BUS100 is recommended.

Any free elective can go here. Recommended: ECON312 (note that ECON311 is a prerequisite). ECON303 and ECON304 double count for D5 and ECON elective. ECON303 also counts for USCP credit. Double Counting will cause an increase in the number of free electives needed.

Any free elective can go here. Recommended: ECON313 (note that ECON312 is a prerequisite). ECON303 and ECON304 double count for D5 and ECON elective. ECON303 also counts for USCP credit. Double Counting will cause an increase in the number of free electives needed.
The concentration declaration should be submitted during this time.

Any ECON 300-400 level course can go here. ECON303 and ECON304 double count for D5 and ECON elective. ECON303 also counts for USCP credit. Double Counting will cause an increase in the number of free electives needed.

20 units Approved Electives required. See catalog for course options. Consultation with an advisor is recommended prior to choosing approved electives. Courses in Analytics or in Statistics and Decision Analysis provide a focus in analytics. Courses in Statistics and Decision Analysis or in Mathematical Foundations are recommended for students pursuing post-baccalaureate studies.

Any free elective can go here. Recommended: ECON339. ECON303 and ECON304 double count for D5 and ECON elective. ECON303 also counts for USCP credit. Double Counting will cause an increase in the number of free electives needed.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR class or GWR exam can go here. Refer to the current catalog for prerequisites.

Two Technology Management Major Requirements that can double count for Area F (ITP330 and ITP341). Double counting will cause an increase in the number of free elective units. See catalog for course options.
